page.title: 17HANDICRAFTS
page.content: Handicrafts have always been part of living, but in recent times have become more popular. In the villages around Bredon Hill, there has been a great revival in the art of lace making and several people are also learning the art of tatting. This is sometimes called "poor mans lace", but it is in fact an art in it's own right. Both spinning and weaving are coming into their own, with some people starting with the fleece and finishing with the completed garment. Other types of craft still being practised are macrame, enamelling, pressed flower decorations, pewter jewellery, soft toys, cane and rush work, paper crafts and every conceivable type of canvas work and embroidery.
